H0.text: Hills are smaller and more rounded than mountains.

H1.text: Hills are deeper and more level than mountains.

H2.text: Hills are steeper and rockier, which is the main way they differ from mountains.

H3.text: Hills are taller and snowy, which are the ways that most differentiate them from mountains.

A4.text: Some authorities regard eminences above 600 metres (1,969 ft) as mountains, those below being referred to as hills.

A5.text: A mountain is an elevated portion of the surface of a planet, generally with steep sides that show significant exposed bedrock.
